| Goal | How it is expressed mathematically |

| Guideline | Recommended approach |
|-----------|----------------------|
| **World Health Organization (WHO, 2022)** | Use a **range of 0.5–1.0 mg L⁻¹** and select a value near the **lower end** for hot climates (≥ 20 °C mean annual temperature) and near the **upper end** for cold climates. |

| **Health Canada (2022)** | Target **0.7 mg L⁻¹** but recommends **adjustments of ±0.1 mg L⁻¹** when average daily water intake differs by > 20 % from the assumed 1.5 L day⁻¹ for adults. |

> **Bottom line:**  The *principle* of temperature‑adjusted dosing is widely accepted; the *exact magnitude* of the adjustment varies by jurisdiction.
